alert.note: Alert for Van Wert (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 10:58AM EST until March 06 at 7:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Indiana... Auglaize River near Fort Jennings affecting Allen OH, Paulding and Putnam Counties. Maumee River near Defiance affecting Defiance and Henry Counties. Maumee River at Fort Wayne affecting Paulding and Allen IN Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier affecting Williams County. Saint Marys River near Decatur affecting Adams, Allen IN and Van Wert Counties. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Defiance, Fulton OH and Williams Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Defiance, Allen IN and De Kalb Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Indiana... Saint Joseph River Ohio near St. Joe River Ft. Wayne affecting Allen IN County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saint Marys River near Decatur. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, County Road 225 North...just north of Pleasant Mills Indiana is closed by flood water. Low land areas of Kekionga Park on the southeast side of Decatur begin flooding. Flooding is limited to farm land in Pleasant Mills Indiana and Willshire Ohio. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EST Saturday was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening to 15.3 feet early Monday afternoon. It will rise to 15.6 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
